You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
ENHANCE YOUR CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE WITH SALESFORCE FEEDBACK MANAGEMENT
Customize the Thank You Message

Customize the message that participants see when they finish the survey. Write multiple messages and then create the logic that determines which message participants view.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: both Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions
Available with the Feedback Management - Starter and Feedback Management - Growth licenses


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To customize the Thank You page:	

Permissions to create surveys

In the Survey Builder, on the Thank You page, turn on Customize Page.
Using the rich-text editor, enter a default thank you message of up to 1,000 characters and, optionally, additional details. Or,
Click Add Custom Message to create a message.
When you have two or more messages, define which message participants see based on a response to a survey question or based on merge field criteria.
Click Display Logic for a custom message.
Select whether the custom message appears for any or all conditions that you define.
For Logic Type, select Response to Question to show participants a thank you message based on an earlier response. Otherwise, select a merge field variable to show a message based on merge field criteria.
Select the question or merge field for the condition.
NOTE You can't define conditions based on ranking questions.
Select an operator.
NOTE Selecting equals as the operator for multiple selection questions doesn’t work as expected. Select contains as the operator instead.
Select or enter a response or field value that determines when the custom message shows.
To define another condition, click Add Condition.
Save the logic, and then to apply it, save the survey.
EXAMPLE

A survey has three pages.

The first page contains a New Promoter Score (NPS) question: How likely are you to recommend our service to a friend or colleague?
The second page contains a text question: Let us know what you didn't like.
The third page is the Thank You page with a default message and a custom message.

Add display logic to the custom thank you message. When the participant’s response to the NPS question is 7 or more, go directly to the Thank You page with the custom message.

DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Let us know so we can improve!
Yes
No
title: Customizing the Thank You Message in Salesforce Feedback Management
